channel.description: Recent content on Álvaro A. Gutiérrez Vargas

item.title: Using aggregate in R
item.description: 1 Using aggregate in R 1.1 Example data 1.2 Mean of the age by affiliation 1.3 Small improvement: Include the names on the go… 1.4 Combining aggregate with user-made functions: Count integrants 1.5 Using a little bit more elaborate function: The second integreant by affiliation. 2 Refferences 1 Using aggregate in R QWERTYUIOP A few examples related to the usage of aggregate function. 1.1 Example data df <- data.

item.title: Reshape using dplyr
item.description: 1 Reshape using dplyr 1.1 A journey from long-land to the wide format town. 2 References 1 Reshape using dplyr 1.1 A journey from long-land to the wide format town. Here we simulate data in long format. # Data in long format library(dplyr) set.seed(777) my.df <- data.frame(id=rep(c("A","B","C"), 5), TIME=rep(1:5, each=3), X=1:15, Y=16:30) %>% group_by(id) %>% mutate(fix_per_id = rpois(1, lambda = 5))%>% arrange(id) ## # A tibble: 15 x 5 ## # Groups: id [3] ## id TIME X Y fix_per_id ## <chr> <int> <int> <int> <int> ## 1 A 1 1 16 6 ## 2 A 2 4 19 6 ## 3 A 3 7 22 6 ## 4 A 4 10 25 6 ## 5 A 5 13 28 6 ## 6 B 1 2 17 5 ## 7 B 2 5 20 5 ## 8 B 3 8 23 5 ## 9 B 4 11 26 5 ## 10 B 5 14 29 5 ## 11 C 1 3 18 4 ## 12 C 2 6 21 4 ## 13 C 3 9 24 4 ## 14 C 4 12 27 4 ## 15 C 5 15 30 4 With the followin code we can put it into wide format.

item.title: randregret at the UK Stata Meeting - London, 2020!
item.description: UK Stata Meeting - London, 2020. Slides from my presentation at the UK Stata Meeting should render below, if not you can get them from this link. I hope you enjoy them! Any questions are very welcome to my email :) Also the repository with the source code and examples can be found here: https://github.com/alvarogutyerrez/randregret Also on twitter… Have you ever made a desition that you regret?

item.title: String or not to String on Stata: Collection of usefull tools
item.description: Random string utilities that saved me in the past. Parsing cmdline after a estimation command. . qui reg price rep78 length foreign , robust . local what_I_typed = e(cmdline) . di "`what_I_typed'" regress price rep78 length foreign , robust gettoken: be carefull with the spaces (!!) we can split the command (regress) from the rest. . gettoken command rhs : what_I_typed ,parse(" ,") // first token and the rest .

item.title: TikZ coordinate graph from scratch. The simple, but effective way.
item.description: Lately, I needed to create a couple of graphs to exemplify something in a manuscript that I have been working on. Even though, I was relatively familiar with TikZ, given the immense amount of templates online it was quite difficult to stick to only one, because most of them had so many unnecessary features for my purpose. Finally, using the two references listed at the bottom I came up with something quite useful and intuitive to solve my problem.

item.title: Monte Carlo Simulation of your own Stata command with Mata-generated data.
item.description: This the final step of a series of earlier post where I dealed with the combination of a Mata evaluators within ado files that uses ml to fit Maximum Likelihood Estimations. Here a single dofile is used but it relies in what we have done in my previous post when we built up MyClogit command. The only file needed is the following, and it can be downloaded by clicking on it.

item.title: Write your own command to fit a likelihood using a Mata-evaluator with ml command on Stata
item.description: If you are reading this you should be quite desperate to get an answer about how to deal with the impossible [holy] trinity of put together a (1) d-family Mata evaluator, within an (2) ado file (a.k.a your own new command) that performs a maximum likelihood estimation using (3) -ml- invoking your Mata evaluator. Let me say that you are probably (?) in the write place. Indeed, this post is an improved version of a later post where I fitted a conditional logit using -ml- with Mata-based likelihood function.

item.title: Fitting Conditional Logit using d0 Mata-based evaluator using maximum likelihood -ml- on Stata
item.description: This post is higly based on the excellent book Maximum likelihood estimation with Stata. Stata press Gould, W., Pitblado, J., & Sribney, W. (2006) and by any means tries to be a replacement for such an amazing reference. However, within the chapter 6 devoted to d-family -ml- evaluators, somehow something, in my humble opinion, very important was missing. The missing part was the discussion of Discrete Choice Models as a particular family of models specially suitable for such family of evaluators where ikelihood function does not meet the linearform restrictions.

item.title: [Oto-2019] Introduccion a la Estadistica
item.description: Notas del curso de pregrado Introducción a la Estadística, Facultad Economía y Negocios, Universidad de Chile. Notas incompletas y posiblemente con typos. Leer con precaución. Estadística Descriptiva Notas Slides Propuesto 1 Propuesto 2 Teoría de Probabilidades & Conjuntos Notas Ejericio Resuelto Funciones de Distribución Notas Ejercicio Resuelto

item.title: Are my labels there? Searching among label variables values on Stata
item.description: The problem This brief post answer the question my orignal google search How to check if a value is contained into a label variable on stata? Imagine we have a problem where we need to check if a string is contained into the labels of another variable. Let’s start with a minimal example using sysuse auto and the variable foreing which is the only one with labels already in place.

item.title: [Oto-2019] StataLaTeX Combo
item.description: Este es un compedio del material impartido en el Taller Stata & LaTeX a los alumnos del curso de Econometría Financiera del Master de Finanzas de la Universidad de Chile. S01: Introduccion a LaTeX Enunciado S02: Estadística Descriptiva Enunciado Solución Data S03: Manejo de Bases de Datos Enunciado Solución Data S04: Trabajo con Multi-bases de Datos Enunciado Solución Data S05: Loops & Macros & Automatización Season 1 Enunciado Solución Data

item.title: Research
item.description: Working papers: Is the Effect of Personality Traits on Academic Performance Influenced by Type of Tests and Study-Time Constraints?.(With Pablo Tapia and Renato Aguilar) The Big Five Traits and the Home Mortgage Delinquencies (with Pablo Tapia and Jose Luis Ruiz) Conferences: Sechi 2017, Satiago Chile.: Responsabilidad, Extroversión y Desempeño Académico frente Evaluaciones con Distinta Modalidad Stata Meeting 2020, Bern, Switzerland.

About me. If you navigate up to here means that you deliberately wanted to know more about me. I would say that I am a learner enthusiast in diverse topics, in particular, if they are somehow related to computer programming. Additionally, currently, I reside in Belgium, working on getting my Ph.D. at the Research Centre for Operations Research and Statistics (ORSTAT) at KU Leuven. I do really like computers, and I survive exclusively out of plants.

item.title: [Pri-2019] BI para las Finanzas
item.description: Descripción del Curso Acá podrás encontrar las ayudantías computacionales del curso Business Intelligence para las Finanzas dictado al programa de Magister en Finanzas en la Universidad de Chile. Las clases van desde tópicos sencillos, como manejo de bases de datos mediante Pandas, hasta desarrollo de algotirmos complejos como Redes Neuronales con Scikit-Learn. Sesión #1: Numpy (Numerical Python) En esta sesión aprenderemos cómo ejecutar operaciones básicas del Álgebra Lineal, haciendo uso de la librería Numpy.
